result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dequan Emonny Wright

records.addlTxt:
3:32 PM Defendant Dequan Emonny Wright appeared by video, in custody from Marquette County Jail.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions the defendant as to why he failed to appear on October 17th for an AIA.  Defendant had no way to get here and turned himself in in Waukesha County.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant satisfied
Cash bond will be reinstated
Defendant is not to be released until he contacts the Public Defender's office before he leaves the jail.

Court questions the defendant the status of an Attorney.  Defendant called but then had trouble with his phone so he did not know if they called back.  Defendant is homeless right now.  
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant is not to be released until he contacts the Public Defender's office before he leaves the jail.

11:15 AM Defendant Dequan Emonny Wright not in court.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Juech requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.

11:15 AM Defendant Dequan Emonny Wright appeared by zoom.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant states that he doesn't have an address; his family moved now.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset for an in-person appearance
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:58 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dequan Emonny Wright appeared by phone. 
Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant states that he was denied by the Public Defender's office.  Defendant wants the court to appoint an Attorney.
Court confirms address.

BY THE COURT:  Clerk to send Court Appointed Attorney paperwork
Defendant to send that back in right away
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:27 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dequan Emonny Wright appeared by phone. 
Defendant states he did try to get in touch with an attorney.  Court questions defendant whether he qualifies for PD.  Defendant states he hasn't attempted to call him.  Court gives defendant the PD's phone number.
BY THE COURT:  Court will adjourn this hearing one more time.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No possession of any dangerous weapons *No possession of any firearm

3:38 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dequan Emonny Wright appeared by video, in custody. 
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone. 
Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and will be getting an attorney.  

Atty Burdon requests a $1,000 cash bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No possession of any dangerous weapons
*No possession of any firearm
Initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
